questionList.questionStatement: What impact did World War I have on the colonial system in Africa?
questionList.choiceA: It had no impact at all.
questionList.choiceB: It helped many Africans see the illegitimacy of the colonial system
questionList.choiceC: It strengthened it and made it more secure.
questionList.choiceD: it made Africans appreciate and admire European technology.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following inventions does Not have anything to do with European colonization of Africa at the close of the nineteenth century?
questionList.choiceA: The Maxim gun
questionList.choiceB: The steamship
questionList.choiceC: The telegraph
questionList.choiceD: The motor car

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following statements is wrong about the First World War.
questionList.choiceA: Austria-Hungary competed for the control of overseas colonial possessions.
questionList.choiceB: It was basically the result of economic and political rivalries among the great powers of Europe.
questionList.choiceC: the War affected the peoples of Africa.
questionList.choiceD: It gave rise to the first communist state, the USSR.

questionList.questionStatement: The German war strategy in 1941 known as the
questionList.choiceA: Prussian plan.
questionList.choiceB: Central Powers' plan
questionList.choiceC: Schlieffen plan
questionList.choiceD: Bismarck plan.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the discovery of the New world by European seamen?
questionList.choiceA: Ii was beneficial to local populations in many places.
questionList.choiceB: It benefited only the kings and queens of Europe.
questionList.choiceC: It contributed to the development of capitalism in Europe.
questionList.choiceD: It led to the enslavement of local populations everywhere.

questionList.questionStatement: The super-powers of the Post-World War II era were the
questionList.choiceA: USSR and China
questionList.choiceB: USA and USSR
questionList.choiceC: USSR and Germany
questionList.choiceD: USA and Ja

questionList.questionStatement: A new form of power during the Industrial revolution was
questionList.choiceA: Machine power
questionList.choiceB: Steam power
questionList.choiceC: Water power
questionList.choiceD: Wind power

questionList.questionStatement: In what ways do the Organization of African Unity (OAU) and the African Union (AU) differ from each other?
questionList.choiceA: The former is not committed to colonial boundaries while the latter is.
questionList.choiceB: The former envisions the political union of Africa while the later does not.
questionList.choiceC: The former is dedicated to economic development of Africa while the latter was formed for its liberation from colonialism
questionList.choiceD: The former was committed to principles of sovereignty and no- intervention in internal affairs while the latter is not.

questionList.questionStatement: What was the central idea behind the so-called Truman Doctrine?
questionList.choiceA: That Communists in Cuba should be denied any access to outside support.
questionList.choiceB: That NATO should pursue a more aggressive anti-Soviet effort.
questionList.choiceC: That the American continents should be free of Communist influence.
questionList.choiceD: That Soviet expansion should be contained everywhere.

questionList.questionStatement: Menilek's expansion to the South was different from that of his predecessors
questionList.choiceA: In its intensity and unprecedented degree of success.
questionList.choiceB: In that it was directed against the imperialists.
questionList.choiceC: In that it was interested in spreading Christianity.
questionList.choiceD: In that it was only against his rival Negus Takiahaymanot

questionList.questionStatement: What was the main factor for the failure of Lij lyassu to consolidate power?
questionList.choiceA: His friendship with Somali chiefs
questionList.choiceB: His casual treatment of Shoan notables
questionList.choiceC: His favoritism towards Islam.
questionList.choiceD: His failure to accommodate the wishes of Europeans.

questionList.questionStatement: What was the connection between the Great Depression of late 1929 into the early 1930s and the outbreak of World War II?
questionList.choiceA: Governments wanted war to boost productivity and employment.
questionList.choiceB: Hardships caused by the Depression carried to power extremis groups with aggressive agendas.
questionList.choiceC: There was no connection at all between the two.
questionList.choiceD: The joblessness created by the Depression created a vast reserve of men to deploy in the war.

questionList.questionStatement: Why was resistance to the land reform proclamation of 1975 in Ethiop. limited and ineffective?
questionList.choiceA: Because landlords lacked organization and leadership!
questionList.choiceB: Because the proclamation was not radical enough.
questionList.choiceC: Because most landlords were absentee owners and had little connection with the rural areas.
questionList.choiceD: Because peasants were well organized and armed,

questionList.choiceA: Kwame Nkrumah.
questionList.choiceB: WE. Duhois,
questionList.choiceC: Marcus Garvey

questionList.questionStatement: What does the term gull refer to in Ethiopian political economy?
questionList.choiceA: Rights to military service only
questionList.choiceB: Ownership of land
questionList.choiceC: Hereditary nobility
questionList.choiceD: Rights to tribute

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following was common to the civilizations of the Maya, the Inca and the Aztecs?
questionList.choiceA: They were enemies of each other.
questionList.choiceB: They were all built by native (indigenous) people of the Americas,
questionList.choiceC: They all rose and fell in what is today Mexico.
questionList.choiceD: They were all contemporaneous (existed at the same time).

questionList.questionStatement: In what sense can it be said that the Ethiopian victory at Adwa was incomplete?
questionList.choiceA: In the sense that Menelik severely punished too many Ethiopians for collaborating with the enemy.
questionList.choiceB: In the sense that it did not force the Italians out of the territories beyond the Mereb.
questionList.choiceC: In the sense that the Ethiopians suffered greater casualties.
questionList.choiceD: In the sense that the victory at Adwa was not followed up diplomatically

questionList.choiceB: It was carried out both militarily and peacefully
questionList.choiceC: It was carried out only militarily.
questionList.choiceD: It affected all parts of the country without exception.

questionList.choiceB: The European troops had the advantage of modem firearms

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following would be a primary source for a history of the Fascist occupation of Ethiopia from 1936 -41?
questionList.choiceA: A diary kept by a Fascist governor of a province of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: An inscription on an Ethiopian monument erected after the expulsion of the Fascists.
questionList.choiceC: A book written by an Italian historian in the 1950s.
questionList.choiceD: Oral information that a grandson of a patriot provided to ,a historian.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the study of history?
questionList.choiceA: Its proper area of coverage is politics.
questionList.choiceB: Its primary objective is to instill patriotism.
questionList.choiceC: It is irrelevant for current conditions.
questionList.choiceD: It covers virtually all aspects of the human past.

questionList.choiceA: Haile Sellassie's regime faced growing popular hatred.
questionList.choiceB: The student movement contributed to its outbreak.
questionList.choiceC: It had nothing to do with petroleum price rise. Ages began is
questionList.choiceD: There were several immediate causes for the outbreak of the revolt.

questionList.questionStatement: What was the main factor for the emergence of monarchical rule in the Gibe region early in the nineteenth century?
questionList.choiceA: Trade and trade routes
questionList.choiceB: Islam.
questionList.choiceC: Shift in the system of land tenure.
questionList.choiceD: Influence of neighboring states.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following elements in early Islam contributed to its rapid expansion?
questionList.choiceA: Its animosity to other monotheist religions.
questionList.choiceB: Its egalitarian principles about society.
questionList.choiceC: Its connections to trade anti commerce.
questionList.choiceD: Its emphasis on Jihad and religious martyrdom.

questionList.choiceA: The French

questionList.choiceA: To maintain a good relationship with the state of Israel
questionList.choiceB: To keep a genuine record of the genealogy of Christian emperors.
questionList.choiceC: To justify and legitimize political power To establish peace and order during succession.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the Vietnamese resistance to American intervention in the 1960s and 1970s?
questionList.choiceA: It was communist in the north and nationalist in the south.
questionList.choiceB: It was more nationalist than communist.
questionList.choiceC: It was both nationalist and communist.
questionList.choiceD: It was more communist than nationalist.

questionList.choiceA: That humans are in control of their own destiny.

questionList.choiceA: It is a moral philosophy that preaches equality among all human beings.

questionList.questionStatement: Giving the exact date as to when the European Middle difficult because
questionList.choiceA: It came before the ancient world.

questionList.questionStatement: The two main immediate factors for the colonization of Africa in the middle of the 1880s were
questionList.choiceA: The British takeover of Egypt in 1882 and unification of Italy.
questionList.choiceB: The rise of Bismarck and the revolt of Urbai Pasha of Egypt in 1882.
questionList.choiceC: the French conquest of Algeria in 1830 and British occupation of Cape Colony.
questionList.choiceD: the British occupation of Egypt in 1882 and the involvement of Germany and King Leopold of Belgium in the scramble for Africa.

questionList.choiceA: Plato

questionList.questionStatement: What is the hang theory?
questionList.choiceA: A Marxist theory about the creation of the earth.
questionList.choiceB: The argument that the universe emerged out of a hot and dense mass through some sort of cosmic explosion.
questionList.choiceC: The theory that the earliest hominids collected stone implements in the wake of big volcanic eruptions.
questionList.choiceD: A theological argument about the creation of humanity by the Creator.
